data.title: Never judge a book by its cover.
data.text:
Although it doesn't look much from the outside - or the inside to be honest - this is a great little place for a normally priced breakfast or brunch and beats many of the more expensive alternatives. 
Great service and plenty of choices.

data.title: Small and ugly but the food is nice
data.text: I tried the Brickell's branch before and that is large and bright. And the food is very nice. Now I visited the South Beach's branch and the food has the same quality and the price is ok but the place here is quite unpleasing. If the food is all you are searching for there is no reason to avoid this place.

data.title: Very tasty treats!
data.text: I went a little late as we slept in and they were out of quite a few items but what we had was very good.  I would visit again when in town.

data.title: good cheap breakfast
data.text: Miami Beach is expensive.  This is a place where you can have a cheap breakfast with high quality.  The sandwiches are very good as well as the coffee.  The place isn't that nice as an ambiance but it´s ok if you want to switch for that extremely expensive breakfast at a premium hotel.

data.title: Every time we go to SoBe we visit La Provence bakery...our go-to place for croissants
data.text: Since we first started staying in the Collins Ave/Lincoln Road area nearly 15 years ago, La Provence has been our go-to breakfast place.  They have delicious croissants and yummy breakfasts for reasonable prices...eggs scrambled w/bacon, side salad, french bread for about $7.

data.title: Light breakfast
data.text: We are vacationing in Miami Beach and stopped here for a light breakfast.  Coffee was very good. We each had a yogurt parfei, and shared a orange muffin and croissant.  Best croissant we have had. Very light. Nice place and would go back.

data.title: Great Breakfast, sandwiches and pastries.
data.text: La Provence is one of the few reasonably priced restaurants on this particular stretch of Miami Beach sandwiched as it is between Loews Miami Beach Hotel and the Ritz-Carlton. The breakfasts are excellent and they have great sandwiches for lunch as well as a great selection of pastries. You can get a solid breakfast for around $10. I highly recommend it.

data.title: A good breakfast spot!
data.text: We've had many breakfasts at this eatery.  The ham and cheese croissant is delicious and filling.  You can't beat a hot cup of coffee and an apple pastry for breakfast.  Quick service with fair pricing.

data.title: Parisian in Miami
data.text: This place has every french cuisine you would want. The service is great and so is the food quality. I recommend this place for breakfast!

data.title: GRIMY, GRUBBY, UNKEPT! 👎
data.text:
Dropped by La Provence to buy a baguette because there were none available at Rosetta Bakery across the street. My initial reaction upon entering was the space was what an unkempt, grimy & grubby restaurant. Just not a place where I would chose to eat any food! The dark, moss green paint is peeling & chipping off the walls. I stopped in the ladies washroom - that was also badly in need of a coat of fresh paint. The whole place just feels like it needs to be scrubbed, scoured & painted. My husband did line up for a baguette but I couldn't bring myself to eat it....I'd skip a bakery visit to the 
"Grimy La Provence"  & head cross the street to the "Delightful Rosetta's Bakery"!

data.title: One of my Favorite French Bakery
data.text: I really like this place, if I could, I'll have breakfast or lunch here everyday, fresh baked bread, great variety, there is something for everyone over there !

data.title: Great Bakery and Deli
data.text: This French Bakery on Collins and Lincoln road has excellent coffee and pastries as well as delicious breakfast sandwiches. The deli subs for lunch are fantastic as well as the salads

data.title: Excellent Quality / Good Quality
data.text: Very french food... simple flavors but with excellent quality of ingredients. Don't forget dessert, everything was delicious.

data.title: A cheaper alternative than some places
data.text: Having tried the bakery across the road the day before, my wife and I thought to try this place the next day for breakfast. On arrival the place seemed dull and in need of slight modernisation. The menu itself is extensive and good value for money. The food was to an ok standard. If you want to budget your money wisely while eating out in Miami I would recommend going here.

data.title: Management has a 'tude
data.text:
So we had breakfast here 3-4 times. The food was pretty good, and the service was reasonable, for the most part.

Croque Monsieur and Madame were both good. My kids loved the muffins. Coffee was pretty good.

However...

After eating breakfast I ordered an espresso to go. It took a while for the to get around to it, and then it sat there on the counter for several minutes before being handed to me. I said, "it's been sitting there a while. How about a fresh one?" 

The French speaking employee (owner maybe) insisted that it had not been sitting there, but even still, this is America, I do it your way.

He's right. He did it the American way. Half assed, and when called out on it somehow made it my impression that was wrong and not his actions. 

Despite the attitude, we'll be back because it's too easy and the food was good enough. Next time I won't order coffee.

data.title: Delicious breakfast
data.text: Close to our hotel on Collins Ave , fast service and delicious pastries and croissants! The coffee was good too and prices were a bit less than hotel food.

data.title: Stop here for dessert
data.text:
We were headed back to the hotel after walking a little longer at the Lincoln Road Mall and spotted La Provence across the street we were on. On a whim, we decided we needed some dessert now that dinner had packed down some. So we headed in.
The place is pretty nondescript, until you look at the pasty display. There were so many things from which to choose it was difficult to decide, but we settled on a couple of different Mouse cakes. These were not huge, but the perfect size for a single serving. And were they tasty. I had a chocolate raspberry and my wide had all chocolate. Not too sweet and very good. We also had what was probably the best cup of coffee I had in a two week period.
They also had savory dishes for lunch and dinner. They also looked very good and I would love to try some if we ever make it back.
Recommended

data.title: Hot nice and delicious next to beach and lincoln street
data.text: Small but fast ... delicious dont recommend all sandwiches . Omlette is fine. Croissant is great bread is medditerranen style so we love it....

data.title: Disappointment.
data.text: Went for breakfast. Should have gone somewhere else. When my wife expressed dissatisfaction with her meal, employee just walked away, no apology, no offer to make it right. Coffee was ok.

data.title: Great for Bkfast and lunch
data.text:
WE ate there a lot during our few days in SOBE and we loved it. 
They have great croissants; great Yogurt parfait which are very generous in Yogurt but less so in fruits and Granola.  We tried their excellent salads and the pancake was decent as well. 
WE did not try the tarts and desserts but they looked awesome; just like in Paris. 
And of course being in MB; its expensive. 11$ for the Pancake (see picture) a 2 bits of fruits.
